Instruction: Brown the chicken breasts in a skillet over medium heat with melted butter until golden on both sides, about 5 minutes each side. The chicken will still be slightly pink inside. Remove chicken and set aside.

Brown the chicken breasts in a skillet with melted butter until lightly golden on both sides, approximately 5 minutes per side. Transfer the chicken to a plate once browned. Next, sauté onion until translucent in the same skillet, then add fennel, celery seed, black pepper, and cream. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the sauce is slightly thickened. Return the chicken to the skillet, spooning the sauce over the chicken, and continue cooking until chicken is fully cooked, about 10 minutes.
